title: Font used in El Lissitsky Design?
content:
Does anyone know what the font in this image is? I'm doing an assignment and can't work out the font.. It kind of looks like some-sort of stencil..

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100201072122im_/http:/typophile.com/files/lissitsky_6569.jpg)
author: kaylalee_

comments.content:
I have redesigned each and every element of "Beat the Whites with the Red Wedge" as characters in a typeface by the same name. As I have seen all lettering has been handrawn, and have based on a San Serif typeface.  
It should be easy to find out which one by looking through typefaces designed before 1919 with a similar "M" [in клином]and "C" [in красных] that were in use around 1919. One should take into account the fact that while being handrawn the letterforms were either condensed or based on a condensed weight of the typeface in question. The closest typefaces that are similar are ITC Johnston (1916) and Gill Condensed (1928-32), also Erbar (1922).
Thanks so much!! :D I'll check them out. :)
